benchmark_details.name: VGBench
benchmark_details.overview: VGBench is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) on vector graphics understanding and generation across diverse tasks and prompting techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The goal of VGBench is to evaluate LLMs' vector graphics processing capabilities, including both understanding and generation aspects across various vector graphics formats.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The paper acknowledges limitations in assessing closed-source models and suggests that more evaluations can be conducted.

data.source: Vector graphics samples were collected from existing datasets and the Internet including SVG, TikZ, and Graphviz formats.
data.annotation: QA pairs are curated through a semi-automated process with human filtering.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the correctness of chosen options against ground-truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on accuracy across various tasks and graphics formats.
methodology.validation: Evaluation for both understanding and generation tasks is conducted under multiple LLMs including comparison with VLMs.
